newsitem.title: USA: Ziff-Davis, SpotMedia to form Web gaming company.
newsitem.headline: Ziff-Davis, SpotMedia to form Web gaming company.

text.p: Ziff-Davis Publishing Co and SpotMedia Communications on Thursday will announce plans to form a company to operate a Web site featuring comprehensive information about computer and video games.

The new company will be run by the existing SpotMedia management team and majority-owned by Ziff Davis. SpotMedia, a private San Francisco company started in January, operates the popular "GameSpot" site on the Internet's World Wide Web.
The two companies together plan to invest $15 million to $20 million in the venture, according to sources close to the deal. Ziff-Davis is owned by Softbank Corp 9984.T.

Once a definitive agreement has been reached, SpotMedia's GameSpot site and the on-line content of Ziff-Davis -- including Computer Gaming World, Electronic Gaming Monthly, CyberSports, Intelligent Gamer and -- will be merged into a single Web site, sources close to the deal said.

Since its launch, the GameSpot site has become one of the PC game industry's preferred on-line advertising vehicles. Advertisers on the site have included Microsoft Corp, Sierra On-Line, Interactive Magic and other game and hardware developers.
By combining GameSpot and Ziff-Davis's content, the companies hope to double their combined traffic.
